name: Northland COVID-19 Vaccination Centres
services-description:
To check your eligibility for a COVID-19 vaccination, click here.

From 30 June 2021 all people in Group 3 are eligible for COVID-19 vaccination.  This is a large group of people so vaccinations will take place over several months. 

Group 3 will be contacted soon to book their COVID-19 vaccination.  You do not need to do anything now.

If you are on the list below, you can book for your COVID-19 vaccination.        

  • aged 50 years and over, or
  • Kuia, kaumātua and their whānau (the people they live with and their carers)
  • Aged 16-64 and have a relevant underlying health condition, or
  • are disabled, or
  • are in a position of caring for a person with a disability, or
  • are pregnant (any trimester).

If you are in the above groups, you can expect to receive an invitation from Northland DHB to book a vaccination appointment by the 23 July.

If you do not receive an invitation by then please contact the national booking 0800 number - 0800 28 29 26.

For more information, visit immunisation.northernregion.health.nz

To register for your FREE COVID-19 Vaccine Phone - 0800 28 29 26 – 8am until 8pm - Monday to Sunday.  

  • The Northland COVID-19 0800 number (0800 28 29 26) is now staffed by a health call centre.  They are still experiencing a large volume of calls so please be patient.  
  • At this time we do not have any walk-in availability.  We will advise if this changes.  
  • You do not need to know your National Health Index number (NHI) to book an appointment.  
  • It is really important that you provide your full legal name – not an alias name or a nickname. 
  • Please do not turn up any earlier than 15 minutes prior to your appointment and we ask that you respect our COVID-19 Vaccination Community Clinic staff, who are working tirelessly to vaccinate our community.

There is one central vaccination clinic in Rotorua and Tāupo.

  • The Rotorua clinic is located at Central Mall, next to Noel Leeming, Rotorua Central Mall, Amohau Street.
  • The Taupō central clinic is located at Unit 6, 29 Totara Street, across from the Taupō Hospice Shop.

To make a booking at either of these clinics, please go to www.bookmyvaccine.nz. 

COVID-19 VACCINATION OUTREACH CLINICS

Whānau can also book in at vaccination outreach clinics which are scheduled throughout the rohe. The upcoming outreach clinics are listed here.

The outreach clinics are being run by and are for our hapū in:

  • Whakapoungakau
  • Ngongotahā
  • Mangakino
  • Kaingaroa
  • Ngāti Whakaue

Additional vaccination outreach clinics are being added to the calendar all the time – please go to https://tearawacovid19.nz/vaccination/ to keep up to date with the latest information.

Hapū members living in the following outreach clinic areas can call us directly on

0508 TE ARAWA (832 7292) to make a booking and to get all the information. 

BOOK YOUR VACCINATION BY CLICKING ON A LINK BELOW:

  • Central Mall site, Rotorua
  • Ngongotahā
  • Whakapoungakau, Ruamata Marae
  • Kaingaroa Forest Village

Vaccinations will be given by trained health professionals and like all other immunisations, you will need to wait 20 minutes after the vaccination to ensure you have no side effects. You will then be scheduled for your second dose of the vaccination 21 days later. BOTH doses are required to have the best protection against the virus.

name: Clutha Health First Health Centre
services-description:
Covid-19 vaccinations are now under way for eligible people across the Southern district.

Clutha Health First is operating weekend clinics, Saturday and Sunday 9am - 4pm for our registered patients who have been invited to book and attend for their vaccination.

Group Eligibility

If you have been invited to book for your vaccination and have been given a booking code, please use this but do not share it. This is to ensure patients have the chance to receive their vaccine in the age based priority decided by the Ministry of Health.

  • From the 28th July, patients in group 4 over the age of 60 years will be invited to book an appointment.
  • From the 11th August, patients in group 4 aged 55 years and older will be invited to book an appointment.
  • From mid to late August, patients in group 4 aged 45 years and over will be invited to book an appointment.
  • From mid to late September, patients in group 4 aged 35 years and over will be invited to book an appointment. 
  • From October, patients in group 4 aged 16 years and over will be invited to book an appointment. 

If you are unsure which group you are in please use the Unite Against Covid Tool.

Booking your Appointment

Bookings are essential.

When you are invited to book for your vaccine, click here to visit the booking page. 

If you require assistance with your booking, please phone for assistance on 0800 28 29 26, available 8am – 8pm, daily.

If you are getting a flu, MMR or other vaccine, it will affect timing of the COVID-19 vaccination. Please discuss with your health provider.

hours-description:

If you feel you need to be seen that day we will always fit you in, though we will only have time to deal with your immediate problem.  The nurse will make an initial assessment and you will then normally be seen by your usual doctor.

Home visits
Home visits can be arranged  if you are too unwell to attend the surgery. Please phone and speak to a nurse as early in the day as possible.

If you're aged 60 or over, or you're in groups 1, 2, or 3, you can book your vaccinations now through the Book My Vaccine website. It's the quickest way to make your vaccination appointments. As well as English, you can also set your language to te reo Māori.

  • Click through to Book My Vaccine using this link.

You can also book using the freephone option: 0800 28 29 26

  • the phoneline is open 8am to 8pm, 7 days
  • interpreters are available on the phoneline if you need them
  • when you phone it’s a good idea to have your NHI (National Health Index) number ready to make the booking process quicker. You’ll find your NHI number on a prescription, x-ray or test result, or a letter from the hospital.

If you’re not eligible to book yet, you can still register using the website or phone number so we can let you know when it’s your time to book.

Bookings for everyone else will open soon in age bands, from oldest to youngest. Once it’s your time to book, there’s no cut off — you can book any time. If you were sent an invitation earlier but haven’t booked yet, you can reserve your spot at any time through the website or phone line.

For more information on the rollout in Nelson, Tasman and Marlborough, visit the Nelson Marlborough Health website.

name: Wadestown Medical Practice
services-description:
Covid Vaccination appointments available: weekday evenings and  Saturday mornings only.

Kia ora,

Wadestown Medical Practice is proud to announce that we are now offering the Pfizer COVID19 Vaccine.

5:00pm to 7.30pm on weekdays 

9.30am to 1pm on Saturdays.

You MUST have a booked appointment to receive your vaccines.

Please do not contact our medical centre reception about this. Instead we have a dedicated COVID19 Vaccine Clinic team who you can contact with all your details to arrange both of your vaccines, their details are:

Email: covidvaccine@wadestownmedical.co.nz with your preferred weekday  evening/Saturday availability and [Provide your name and address and NHI number.] Or you can also text this info to 027 380 1236.

Thank you for your patience as we arrange vaccines for our community, we know these clinics have been highly anticipated so we intend to respond to all requests as soon as we are able to.

What to expect when you come for your COVID19 Vaccine appointment:

  • You must book an appointment in advance, no walk-ins will be accepted.
  • There is no charge for your vaccine.
  • Only those 16 years and over can have the vaccine.
  • You will need to wait here at least 20 minutes after having your vaccine.
  • You must be well on the day of your vaccine.
  • You may bring a support person if absolutely necessary but due to our small waiting area it is best if only those who have an appointment for a vaccine are here.
  • Please come on time for your appointment and do not miss your appointment so that your vaccine does not go to waste.
  • If you are unwell on the day or discover you cannot make your appointment you will need to call or email our COVID Vaccine team to reschedule. Give us as much warning as you can!
  • Please wear clothes that enable our vaccinators to easily access your upper arm. While you wait for your vaccine you can help us by removing your coat/outer layer(s) in preparation for your vaccine.
  • You will need to wait at least 2 weeks after any vaccine before you can have your COVID19 vaccines. Please let our COVID Vaccine team know if you have had a vaccine recently.
  • Please let us know if you have ever had any severe reaction to anything in the past eg. Throat swelling, anaphylaxis or severe rash. Or if you have any blood disorder, as we may have to monito your vaccine appointment differently.

Thanks,

The Team at Wadestown Medical
